protocol_name: Cell Viability Assay with Sapphire700™ Stain and the Odyssey® CLx and Sa Imaging Systems
protocol_name_html: Cell Viability Assay with Sapphire700™ Stain and the Odyssey® CLx and Sa Imaging Systems
description:
{"blocks":[{"key":"avim7","text":"Cell viability can be assessed based on various cellular features and mechanisms. These include cell membrane integrity (detected by cell impermeable dyes or leakage of intracellular lactate dehydrogenase (LDH) activity), monitoring of ATP with bioluminescence assays, determining esterase activity with Calcein-AM or Fluorescein-DA, measuring cellular Redox status with MTT, MTS, WST, or XTT, and detecting the mitochondrial membrane potential with JC-1. Various cell viability assays have been developed for plate readers (monitoring absorbance and luminescence), flow cytometry, and image cytometry (e.g. NucleoCounter® NC-3000TM from ChemoMetec); however, none of these assays have been optimized for near-infrared detection with the Odyssey Imaging System.","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"4bijt","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"do5a","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"esdef","text":" ","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"14cms","text":" This collection contains protocols to perform the assay with 3 different cell lines:","type":"unstyled","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"3f38u","text":"Saponin-treated A431 Cells","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"1qq63","text":"Staurosporine-treated Jurkat Cells","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}},{"key":"did6e","text":"Camptothecin-treated RAW264.7 Cells
  
 
 
 ","type":"unordered-list-item","depth":0,"inlineStyleRanges":[],"entityRanges":[],"data":{}}],"entityMap":{}}
manuscript_citation:
1. Gani OA, Engh RA (2010) Protein kinase inhibition of clinically important staurosporine analogues. Nat   

    Prod Rep. 27: 489-98

 

2. Gescher A. (2000) Staurosporine analogues – pharmacological toys or useful antitumor agents? Crit Rev

    Oncol Hematol. 34: 127-35

 

3. Venditto VJ, Simanek EE (2010) Cancer therapies utilizing the camptothecins: a review of the in vivo

    literature. Mol Pharm. 7: 307-49

protocols.protocol_name: Cell Viability Assay on Saponin-treated A431 Cells
protocols.protocol_name_html: Cell Viability Assay on Saponin-treated A431 Cells
protocols.description: This protocol describes a cell viability assay that uses near-infrared fluorescent detection. Sapphire700 Stain is used to determine cell viability by assessing cell membrane integrity, and the assay is imaged with the Odyssey CLx Imaging System.
